energy_interpretation: Brent crude at $71.90 is the sole benign stress indicator, well below the $85 elevated threshold. If Brent spikes above $85 on any Hormuz escalation, the Japan stress complex would rapidly compound — JGB yields, yen, and trade deficit would simultaneously deteriorate.

bear_case.bear_narrative: XRP at $1.36 in an extreme fear environment with persistent macro stress places the <$1 bear scenario within striking distance if conditions deteriorate further. The two most critical kill switches — ODL volume and PermissionedDEX institutional count — have zero data, and without them the thesis is structurally unverifiable. BIS Project Nexus remains the most credible sovereign-grade alternative to XRPL's bridge function. The XRP ETF flow divergence ($5.2M weekly inflow) is real but mathematically insufficient — at current pace, ETF AUM would reach ~$1.4B by EOY, far short of the $5B target. Price appreciation is doing the heavy lifting for this thesis, and price is going the wrong direction.
